io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary

Class Observer<T extends android.view.View>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.launchowl.viewvalidationlibrary.Observer<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the type of View that needs to respond to the state of the observed view

    public abstract class Observer<T extends android.view.View>
extends java.lang.Object
    This abstract class is used to observe changes to a View and notify a separate view if the changes are valid.

    Observers are provided to Validator instances and are notified after all conditions of a Criteria object are evaluated via the Validator.validate() method.

    See Also:
    Validator, Criteria, Criteria.AsyncCondition, Criteria.Condition

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Observer(T observerView)
      Class constructor that is supplied with the view that needs to respond to the state of the observed view.

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected abstract void onValidationComplete(T view, Validator.ValidationResult validationResult)
      This abstract method defines what will happen to the observer's view based upon the current state of the view being validated.

    • Method Detail

      • onValidationComplete

        protected abstract void onValidationComplete(T view,
                                             Validator.ValidationResult validationResult)
        This abstract method defines what will happen to the observer's view based upon the current state of the view being validated. 

         // Assuming the view is a android.widget.Button
 

  protected void onValidationComplete(Button view, Validator.ValidationResult validationResult) {
   view.setEnabled(validationResult == Validator.ValidationResult.Valid);
  }
        Parameters:
        view - the View supplied to the Observer(View) constructor
        validationResult - the state of the view being validated
